text: so we already spoke about the root mean
Square velocity of any set of points now

in gases root mean Square velocity is

so V RMS is equal to theun of 3 * R * T
/ M where m is our molar mass of gas T
is our temperature in Kelvin and R is
the mol gas
constant now I or my goal is I want to
use this VMS to find the average kinetic
energy because remember kinetic energy
of anything is given by 12 * Mass * V ^
2 now to find the kinetic average
I basically plug in my vrms into my v
and that will give me the average
because remember this guy is the average
or the quadratic average of my sets of

take my formula for vrms for dces and
plug into my
equation the radical will disappear
because the radical has an exponent of a

* Mass over mol mass time R and T now
remember molar mass has units of mass

will cancel and moles will go on top and
we'll get 12 the mass will cancel so
this m this H this m and this m will
cancel the moles will go on top and
we'll have R *
T so my final uh representation of my
kinetic or average kinetic energy is 3 *
n * R * T / 2 where n is our number of
moles so suppose we have one mole of any
gas well since we we have one mole our n
will be one and for one mole our formula
be becomes average kinetic energy of 1
mole of gas is equal to 3 * R * T / two
so the only non-constant in this

depends strictly on temperature or one

to find one molecule what's the kinetic
average of one molecule of gas and not
one mole well remember a mole has an
avagadro number of molecules so I simply
take my formula and divide it by n so 3
* R * 2 / 2 N the reason I singled out
the r and the N is because this guy is
known as the boltman constant in other
words scientist use some value K that
equals R / n so we replace this R / n
with K called the boltman constant
and our equation becomes 3 * K * T over
2 which is the same thing as saying 3 *
R * T / by 2 * n so once again for one
molecule a single molecule to find the
kinetic average of that molecule we
simply div use this formula where K is
our boltman constant now to find the
average kinetic energy of a mole of
molecules we have to use this formula
now note that any at any given time our

on average a mole of molecules will have
